results.name: Digital sum (in base 10) of numbers in base 3 of the alternate number system.
comment: The alternate number system has no need for the digit zero.
reference: Robert R. Forslund, A Logical Alternative to the Existing Positional Number System, Southwest Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics. Vol. 1 1995 pp. 27-29.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
R. R. Forslund, A logical alternative to the existing positional number system, Southwest Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics, 1995 Vol. 1.
EMIS, Mirror site for Southwest Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(k=3); while(n>k, n-=k; k*=3); my(d=digits(n+k-1,3)); vecsum(d) + #d - 2} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 27 2020
